s1.name: Latest News
s1.subtitle: August 7, 2003: JORAM 3.6 connects J2ME devices!
s1.p: JORAM 3.6 follows the 3.4 release in addressing the opening of the JORAM platform to heterogenous client applications. Where JORAM 3.4, with the support of SOAP as client communication protocol, opened the platform to non-Java applications, the 3.6 release, with its new kJORAM libraries, allows J2ME applications to use JORAM messaging functionnalities. A J2ME application is a lightweight Java application deployed and running on a mobile device such as a PDA or a smart phone.

In the download area you will find the usual JORAM sources and jars-only packages (joram-3.6.0-src.tgz and joram-3.6.0.tgz). You will also find two new packages holding the specific kJORAM client interfaces for the J2ME applications:

ul.li: kjoram-3.6.0-src.tgz, providing the kJORAM sources and sample;
kjoram-3.6.0.tgz providing the kJORAM libraries and sample.

s1.p: JORAM and kJORAM are also available through a CVS checkout, tag joram3_6_0.
The installation and samples guides have been updated to help you having an easy and quick first go with kJORAM. Enjoy!
s1.subtitle: June 24th, 2003: JORAM 3.5 is available under the LGPL licence!
s1.p: JORAM 3.5 is available in the CVS repository (joram3_5_0 tag) as well as packaged. This version is based on the 3.4 release and includes the SOAP proxy. On top of that, it provides a totally refactored message persistence management.
The latest 3.4 update (joram3_4_3) has also been packaged.
The details of all the modifications and bug corrections which occured to the 3.4 release can be found in the releases page.
Documentation has been updated. Particularly, a comparison between the 3.4 and the 3.5 releases performances may be found.
JORAM is now released under the LGPL licence.

s1.name: JORAM: Java (TM) Open Reliable Asynchronous Messaging
s1.subtitle: As a standalone software, JORAM has been downloaded more than 14,000 times
s1.p: JORAM incorporates a 100% pure Java implementation of JMS (Java Message Service API released by Sun Microsystem, Inc.). It provides access to a MOM (Message Oriented Middleware), built on top of the ScalAgent agents based distributed platform.
JORAM, the MOM it gives access to and the Scalagent platform are open source softwares and released under the LGPL license.

s2.name: Specification
s2.p: JORAM provides full support to JMS 1.1:

ul.li: Unified interfaces for the Point-to-Point (PTP) and Publish/Subscribe (Pub/Sub) messaging models
AND still the semantically specific PTP and Pub/Sub interfaces
Full backward compatibility with JMS 1.0.2b compliant applications
TCP and SOAP (HTTP/XML) client-server communication protocols
Message persistence and guarantee of delivery

s2.p: JORAM also includes the following extra-features:

ul.li: A persistent and reliable JNDI server
A timer for pending transacted JMS sessions
Client libraries allowing J2ME applications to access the JORAM platform in a JMS 1.1 "way"

s2.name: Getting Involved
s2.p: Any input or personal view for improving and/or developing JORAM is welcome. JORAM, as an open source project, also welcomes external contributions. Interested? Contact us or check the developer's corner.
